medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute onset abdominal pain localized to right upper quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began yesterday evening with sharp, diffuse abdominal pain, which later localized to the right upper quadrant. The pain was severe enough to keep the patient awake overnight. This is the second episode, with a one-year history of intermittent biliary colic.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Ventricular tachycardia arrest, s/p ICD placement; hemopneumothorax; motor vehicle collision; atrial fibrillation on warfarin; coronary artery disease; congestive heart failure with EF 35%; hypertension; dyslipidemia; moderate aortic regurgitation; mitral regurgitation; pulmonary hypertension; COPD; gout; osteoarthritis.
